My name is Thanasis Troboukis and

I’m a Greek journalist, based in Athens.

This is a list with some projects

I’ve worked on, either in the format

of documentary, photography or data.

Photograph by Thanasis Troboukis

Karachi, Pakistan, 2011

In 2016, the investigative documentary“Babies for Sale” about the illegal trafficking of children from Bulgaria to Greece, which I produced and presented for VICE, was shortlisted for the investigative award at the European Press Prize 2017. In 2017 I participated in the ICIJ’s cross - border investigation of the Paradise Papers. In 2018 I decided to pause my career for a few months and spend the summer in New York at Columbia Journalism School studing at the LEDE Program for Data Journalism with a full scholarship from the Niarchos foundation.

A map with forest fires in Greece

I geocoded 26.000 forest fires which took place from 2000 to 2018 using Python and Google API. The bigger the circle, the bigger the destruction they caused.

Analysing and mapping the fires which have burned down the greek forests, from 2000 to 2018

I did the analysis and visualization of the data in Python and R, geolocated the fires with Google geocoding API and the mappigng in QGIS.

PRESS HERE TO READ

AirBnb is changing Athens

A 3D map showing the concentration of airbnb listings in the neighborhoods of Athens.

My name is Thanasis Troboukis and I’m a Greek journalist, based in Athens. This is a list with some projects I’ve worked on, either in the format of documentary, photography or data.

Photograph by Thanasis Troboukis

Karachi, Pakistan, 2011

If I had to choose three moments in my career, for which I am proud of, one would be the investigative documentary“Babies for Sale” for VICE about the illegal trafficking of children from Bulgaria to Greece (this investigation was shortlisted for the investigative award at the European Press Prize 2017), the cross - border investigation of the Paradise Papers and last but not least my decision to pause my career for a few months and spend the summer of 2018 in New York at Columbia Journalism School studing at the LEDE Program for Data Journalism with a full scholarship from the Niarchos foundation.

A map with forest fires in Greece

I geocoded 26.000 forest fires which took place from 2000 to 2018 using Python and Google API. The bigger the circle, the bigger the destruction they caused.

Analysing and mapping the fires which have burned down the greek forests, from 2000 to 2018

I did the analysis and visualization of the data in Python and R, geolocated the fires with Google geocoding API and the mappigng in QGIS.
